text: Corey Waddell (born 2 October 1996) is a professional rugby league footballer who plays as a forward for the Manly-Warringah Sea Eagles in the NRL. ==Background== Waddell was born in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia. He is the son of former Penrith Panthers and Illawarra Steelers player Steve Waddell.https://www.nrl.com/news/2019/03/23/waddells-dad-steve-always-in-his- thoughts-as-nrl-debut-arrives/ Waddell played his junior rugby league for Emu Plains JRLFC, before signing with Penrith Panthers ==Playing Career== In round 2 of the 2019 NRL season, Waddell made his NRL debut for Manly-Warringah against the Sydney Roosters. In the 2019 Semi-Final against South Sydney, Waddell scored his first NRL try in a 34–26 loss at ANZ Stadium. ==References== ==External links== *NRL profile *Manly Sea Eagles profile Category:1996 births Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Rugby league second-rows Category:Manly Warringah Sea Eagles players Category:Living people
title: Corey Waddell
